info.name: MOTT ManagementAPI
info.description:
Usage:
- Import project "MOTT ManagementAPI" into Postman
- Create a Postman-environment for instance called RedBee OTT Production.
- Define the following variables: mgmtapihost, customer, businessunit, mgmtapiuser, mgmtapipwd, product, assetid and potentiall channelId, programId, publicationId, seriesId, seasonId.

The following values will probably be very static for you.
- mgmtapihost: https://managementapi.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net:443
- customer: The name of your customer.
- businessunit: The name of your business unit.
- mgmtapiuser. The API key id for your management API user.
- mgmtapipwd. The API key secret for your management API user.

The following values will probably change when you do different operations.
- assetId. This is the external asset id, unique for customer. Note that you must change if when doing different ingest, otherwise you will just replace the same asset.
- productId. The name of the product you want to use in your publications. You might want to use just one product or different. A good default value is free_product. That is a default product that is used to give access to all loged in users.
- channelId. Used when you want to perform operations for a live channel. 
- programId. Used when you want to perform operations for a live channel program.
- publicationId. Used when deleting a specific publication.
- seriesId. Used when you want to perform operations for a series.
- seasonid. Used when you want to perform operations for a season.

item.name: VOD Ingest
File ingest

body.raw:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<publish-metadata xmlns="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1 publish-metadata-1.0.xsd">
    <data>
        <asset>
            <id>{{assetId}}</id>
            <titleList>
                <title language="en">Title for {{assetId}} in English</title>
            </titleList>
            <assetType>movie</assetType>
        </asset>
        <material>
            <materialRef>https://emptestdata.blob.core.windows.net/sources/Sintel/sintel.mp4</materialRef>
            <DRMEnabled>false</DRMEnabled>
        </material>
    </data>
</publish-metadata>

request.description:
This will create a bare bones Asset with one unencrypted Material.

The asset will NOT be published and will therefore not be visible to end users and only visible in the Customer Portal.

You have to explicitly tell the system to not use DRM. If you leave out the DRM tag completely the system will default to adding DRM.

body.raw:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<publish-metadata xmlns="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1 publish-metadata-1.0.xsd">
    <data>
        <asset>
            <id>{{assetId}}</id>
            <titleList>
                <title language="en">Title for {{assetId}} in English</title>
            </titleList>
            <assetType>movie</assetType>
        </asset>
        <material>
            <materialRef>https://emptestdata.blob.core.windows.net/sources/Sintel/sintel.mp4</materialRef>
            <DRMEnabled>true</DRMEnabled>
        </material>
    </data>
</publish-metadata>

request.description: This will create a bare bones Asset with one encrypted Material.

body.raw:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<publish-metadata xmlns="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1 publish-metadata-1.0.xsd">
    <data>
        <asset>
            <id>{{assetId}}</id>
            <titleList>
                <title language="en">Title for {{assetId}} in English</title>
            </titleList>
            <assetType>movie</assetType>
        </asset>
        <material>
            <materialRef>https://emptestdata.blob.core.windows.net/sources/Sintel/sintel.mp4</materialRef>
            <DRMEnabled>true</DRMEnabled>
            <subtitleList>
                <subtitle language="en" type="CAPTION">https://emptestdata.blob.core.windows.net/sources/Sintel/sintel_en.vtt</subtitle>
                <subtitle language="sv">https://emptestdata.blob.core.windows.net/sources/Sintel/sintel_se.vtt</subtitle>
                <subtitle language="ar">https://emptestdata.blob.core.windows.net/sources/Sintel/sintel_ar.vtt</subtitle>
                <subtitle language="no">https://emptestdata.blob.core.windows.net/sources/Sintel/sintel_no.vtt</subtitle>
            </subtitleList>
        </material>
    </data>
</publish-metadata>

request.description:
This will create a bare bones Asset with one encrypted Material and four subtitle tracks.

The english subtitle is marked as CAPTION which will mark it as a *Hard of Hearing accessibility track* in the streaming manifests

item.name: Putting it all together and publishing

body.raw:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<publish-metadata xmlns="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1 publish-metadata-1.0.xsd">
    <data>
        <asset>
            <id>{{assetId}}</id>
            <titleList>
                <title language="en">Title for {{assetId}} in English</title>
                <title language="sv">Titel för {{assetId}} på Svenska</title>
            </titleList>
            <assetType>movie</assetType>
        </asset>
        <material>
            <materialRef>https://emptestdata.blob.core.windows.net/sources/Sintel/sintel.mp4</materialRef>
            <DRMEnabled>true</DRMEnabled>
            <subtitleList>
                <subtitle language="en" type="CAPTION">https://emptestdata.blob.core.windows.net/sources/Sintel/sintel_en.vtt</subtitle>
                <subtitle language="sv">https://emptestdata.blob.core.windows.net/sources/Sintel/sintel_se.vtt</subtitle>
                <subtitle language="ar">https://emptestdata.blob.core.windows.net/sources/Sintel/sintel_ar.vtt</subtitle>
                <subtitle language="no">https://emptestdata.blob.core.windows.net/sources/Sintel/sintel_no.vtt</subtitle>
            </subtitleList>
        </material>
        <publicationList>
    	    <publication>
        	    <id>SintelPubl</id>
        	    <startTime>2022-10-01T00:00:00.000Z</startTime>
        	    <endTime>2035-12-31T00:00:00.000Z</endTime>
        	    <publishTime>2022-09-01T00:00:00.000Z</publishTime>
        	    <publicationRights>
            	    <productList>
                	    <product>free_product</product>
            	    </productList>
        	    </publicationRights>
    	    </publication>
	    </publicationList>
    </data>
</publish-metadata>

request.description:
This will create a bare bones Asset with one encrypted Material and four subtitle tracks.

The english subtitle is marked as CAPTION which will mark it as a *Hard of Hearing accessibility track* in the streaming manifests

The asset will also be published so it will be available to end users.  
The Asset will be visible in the app from *publishTime* until *endTime* and the material will be playable from *startTime* until *endTime.***Only users with the product *free_product* will be able to play the asset.

There is much more that can be done using publications, see the Publications collection for more details.

body.raw:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<publish-metadata xmlns="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1 publish-metadata-1.0.xsd">
	<data>
		<asset>
    		<id>{{assetId}}</id>
    		<titleList>
    			<title language="en">Title for {{assetId}} in English</title>
    		</titleList>
    		<assetType>movie</assetType>
        </asset>
		<material>
            <!-- This assumes that we there is a predefined path configured in the system.-->
			<materialRef>Sintel/sintel.mp4</materialRef>
		</material>
	</data>
</publish-metadata>

request.description:
This will create a bare bones Asset with one encrypted Material.

The relative path will be resolved by using the default configuration for standard ingests.

body.raw:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<publish-metadata xmlns="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1 publish-metadata-1.0.xsd">
	<data>
        <asset>
            <id>{{assetId}}</id>
            <titleList>
                <title language="en">Title for {{assetId}} in English</title>
            </titleList>
            <assetType>movie</assetType>
        </asset>
		<material>
			<provider>PreDefinedProvider</provider>
			<materialRef>Sintel/sintel.mp4</materialRef>
		</material>
	</data>
</publish-metadata>

request.description:
This will create a bare bones Asset with one encrypted Material.

To resolve the relative path the configuration specified by the provider tag will be used.

If you have multiple sources of files you can specify multiple providers in our system and then select which one to use for a given ingest.

body.raw:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<publish-metadata xmlns="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1 publish-metadata-1.0.xsd">
	<data>
        <asset>
            <id>{{assetId}}</id>
            <titleList>
                <title language="en">Title for {{assetId}} in English</title>
            </titleList>
            <assetType>movie</assetType>
        </asset>
		<material>
			<provider>PreDefinedProvider</provider>
			<materialRef>Sintel/sintel.mp4</materialRef>
            <subtitleList>
                <subtitle language="ar">Sintel/sintel_ar.vtt</subtitle>
                <subtitle language="no">Sintel/sintel_no.vtt</subtitle>
            </subtitleList>
		</material>
	</data>
</publish-metadata>

request.description:
This will create a bare bones Asset with one encrypted Material and two subtitles.

To resolve the relative path the configuration specified by the provider tag will be used.

All relative paths found in the incoming XML will be resolved towards the specified provider.

item.name: Add subtitles using a complete URL

body.raw:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<publish-metadata xmlns="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1 publish-metadata-1.0.xsd">
	<data>
        <asset>
            <id>{{assetId}}</id>
            <titleList>
                <title language="en">Title for {{assetId}} in English</title>
            </titleList>
            <assetType>movie</assetType>
        </asset>
		<material>
			<provider>PreDefinedProvider</provider>
			<materialRef>Sintel/sintel.mp4</materialRef>
            <subtitleList>
                <subtitle language="ar">Sintel/sintel_ar.vtt</subtitle>
                <subtitle language="no">https://emptestdata.blob.core.windows.net/sources/Sintel/sintel_no.vtt</subtitle>
            </subtitleList>
		</material>
	</data>
</publish-metadata>

request.description:
This will create a bare bones Asset with one encrypted Material and two subtitles.

To resolve the relative path the configuration specified by the provider tag will be used.

All relative paths found in the incoming XML will be resolved towards the specified provider.

Even if you have a provider specified you can still send in absolute URLs for one or more source files. This can be useful eg. for fetching subs from a third party.

item.name: Good to Know

body.raw:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<publish-metadata xmlns="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1 publish-metadata-1.0.xsd">
  <data>
	<material>
  		<materialRef>https://emptestdata.blob.core.windows.net/sources/Sintel/sintel.mp4</materialRef>
    	<assetIdRef>{{assetId}}</assetIdRef>
	</material>
  </data>
</publish-metadata>

request.description:
It is possible to either create a new material on an existing asset OR create a material without ever creating the asset.

However, if you create a Material where the asset doesn't exist we still expect that you will create the Asset at some point so whenever you create the an Asset with the id specified in the assetIdRef tag the Material will be linked to it.

body.raw:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<publish-metadata xmlns="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1 publish-metadata-1.0.xsd">
    <data>
        <asset>
            <id>{{assetId}}</id>
            <titleList>
                <title language="en">Title for {{assetId}} in English</title>
            </titleList>
            <assetType>movie</assetType>
        </asset>
        <material>
            <materialRef>https://emptestdata.blob.core.windows.net/sources/Sintel/sintel.mp4</materialRef>
            <purgeDate>2023-01-01T10:00:00.000</purgeDate>
        </material>
    </data>
</publish-metadata>

request.description:
Specifying a purge date for a Material will cause RBMOTT to delete the Material when that date is reached.

We will not delete the Asset the Material is linked to nor delete any Publications so it's up to you to make sure to remove them if needed.

item.description: A mixed bag of operations that are good to know about

item.name: Picking just one of many tracks

body.raw:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<publish-metadata xmlns="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1">
    <data>
    	 <asset>
            <id>{{assetId}}</id>
            <titleList>
                <title language="en">Title for {{assetId}} in English</title>
            </titleList>
            <assetType>movie</assetType>
        </asset>
        <material>
        	<materialRef>
				<audioList>
    				<audio channels="1" language="en" order="S"/><!-- track 1 is english, stereo -->
				</audioList>
				http://movietrailers.apple.com/movies/lucasfilm/star-wars-the-rise-of-skywalker/star-wars-the-rise-of-skywalker-trailer-1_h1080p.mov
			</materialRef>
		</material>
    </data>
</publish-metadata>

request.description:
Use this when you want to perform a basic ingest without having any real meta-data available. You have one media file.

It is assumed that the there is a storage location defined inside RedBee platform. This is why providing only relative paths are good enough. A storage can be defined either for a whole organization unit or for an organization when a specific provider is defined for the material.

Asset will not be published.

item.name: Combining two mono tracks to one stereo track

body.raw:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<publish-metadata xmlns="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1">
    <data>
    	 <asset>
            <id>{{assetId}}</id>
            <titleList>
                <title language="en">Title for {{assetId}} in English</title>
            </titleList>
            <assetType>movie</assetType>
        </asset>
        <material>
        	<materialRef>
				<audioList>
    				<audio channels="2" language="da" order="LR"/><!-- track 1-2 is danish, left/right stereo -->
				</audioList>
				https://emptestdata.blob.core.windows.net/sources/au8trks/test_au8trks.mxf
			</materialRef>
		</material>
    </data>
</publish-metadata>

request.description:
Use this when you want to perform a basic ingest without having any real meta-data available. You have one media file.

It is assumed that the there is a storage location defined inside RedBee platform. This is why providing only relative paths are good enough. A storage can be defined either for a whole organization unit or for an organization when a specific provider is defined for the material.

Asset will not be published.

body.raw:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<publish-metadata xmlns="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1">
    <data>
    	 <asset>
            <id>{{assetId}}</id>
            <titleList>
                <title language="en">Title for {{assetId}} in English</title>
            </titleList>
            <assetType>movie</assetType>
        </asset>
        <material>
        	<materialRef>
				<audioList>
    				<audio channels="2" language="da" order="LR"/>
    				<audio channels="2s-2" language="fi" order="LR"/>
    				<audio channels="4s-2" language="no" order="LR"/>
    				<audio channels="6s-2" language="sv" order="LR"/>
				</audioList>
                https://emptestdata.blob.core.windows.net/sources/au8trks/test_au8trks.mxf
			</materialRef>
		</material>
    </data>
</publish-metadata>

request.description:
Use this when you want to perform a basic ingest without having any real meta-data available. You have one media file.

It is assumed that the there is a storage location defined inside RedBee platform. This is why providing only relative paths are good enough. A storage can be defined either for a whole organization unit or for an organization when a specific provider is defined for the material.

Asset will not be published.

item.name: Picking audio from a separate file

body.raw:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<publish-metadata xmlns="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1">
    <data>
    	 <asset>
            <id>{{assetId}}</id>
            <titleList>
                <title language="en">Title for {{assetId}} in English</title>
            </titleList>
            <assetType>movie</assetType>
        </asset>
        <material>
        	<materialRef>
				<audioList>
    				<audio channels="2" language="da" order="LR"/>
    				<audio channels="2s-2" language="fi" order="LR"/>
    				<audio channels="4s-2" language="no" order="LR"/>
    				<audio channels="6s-2" language="sv" order="LR"/>
				</audioList>
                https://emptestdata.blob.core.windows.net/sources/au8trks/test_au8trks.mxf
			</materialRef>
		</material>
    </data>
</publish-metadata>

request.description:
Use this when you want to perform a basic ingest without having any real meta-data available. You have one media file.

It is assumed that the there is a storage location defined inside RedBee platform. This is why providing only relative paths are good enough. A storage can be defined either for a whole organization unit or for an organization when a specific provider is defined for the material.

Asset will not be published.

body.raw:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<publish-metadata xmlns="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1 publish-metadata-1.0.xsd">
    <data>
        <asset>
            <id>{{assetId}}</id>
            <titleList>
                <title language="en">Title for {{assetId}} in English</title>
            </titleList>
            <assetType>movie</assetType>
        </asset>
        <material>
            <materialRef>https://emptestdata.blob.core.windows.net/sources/shortbbb/bbb_short.mp4</materialRef>
            <DRMEnabled>false</DRMEnabled>
            <ingestDirective>default51PerTitle</ingestDirective>
        </material>
    </data>
</publish-metadata>

request.description:
Use this when you want to perform a basic ingest without having any real meta-data available. You have one media file.

It is assumed that the media source file is available directly on internet.

Asset will be published. Note that this means that the asset might be available before it is actually ingested and playable so please consider the publication dates carefully.

body.raw:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<publish-metadata xmlns="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1 publish-metadata-1.0.xsd">
  <data>
    <material>
    	<materialRef>{{materialId}}</materialRef>
    	<assetIdRef>{{assetId}}</assetIdRef>
    	<subtitleList>
            <subtitle language="de">https://emptestdata.blob.core.windows.net/sources/shortbbb/bbb_ger_short.vtt</subtitle>
    	</subtitleList>
    </material>
  </data>
</publish-metadata>

item.name: Material - Based On - Add Subtitle And Variant

body.raw:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<publish-metadata xmlns="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1 publish-metadata-1.0.xsd">
  <data>
    <material>
    	<materialRef>{{materialId}}</materialRef>
         <variants>
            <variant>
                <id>america</id>
                <profiles>
                    <profile>sv</profile>
                </profiles>
                <subtitles>
                    <track>en</track>
                </subtitles>
            </variant>
        </variants>
    	<assetIdRef>{{assetId}}</assetIdRef>
    	<subtitleList>
    	    <subtitle language="de">https://emptestdata.blob.core.windows.net/sources/shortbbb/bbb_ger_short.vtt</subtitle>
             <!-- No body means that they will be removed if they exist. -->
            <subtitle language="sv"/>
            <subtitle language="en"/>
    	</subtitleList>
    </material>
  </data>
</publish-metadata>

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<publish-metadata xmlns="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1 publish-metadata-1.0.xsd">
  <data>
    <material>
    	<materialRef>{{materialId}}</materialRef>
    	<assetIdRef>{{assetId}}</assetIdRef>
		<DRMEnabled>true</DRMEnabled>
    </material>
  </data>
</publish-metadata>

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<publish-metadata xmlns="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1">
    <data>
        <material>
            <materialRef>{{materialId}}</materialRef>
            <assetIdRef>{{assetId}}</assetIdRef>
            <dubList>
                <dub language="it" displayName="Italiano">
                    <filename>http://example.com/path/to/auido.mxf</filename>
                </dub>
            </dubList>
        </material>
    </data>
</publish-metadata>

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<publish-metadata xmlns="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1 publish-metadata-1.0.xsd">
	<data>
		<asset>
    		<id>{{assetId}}</id>
    		<titleList>
    			<title language="en">Title for {{assetId}} in English</title>
    		</titleList>
    		<assetType>movie</assetType>
        </asset>
		<material>
            <materialRef>https://emptestdata.blob.core.windows.net/sources/Sintel/sintel.mp4</materialRef>      
            <profiles>
                <profile>profile1</profile>
                <profile>profile2</profile>
            </profiles>
			<DRMEnabled>false</DRMEnabled>
		</material>
	</data>
</publish-metadata>

request.description: Use this this base a new material on a already existing one to avoid incurring extra transcoding and storage costs

body.raw:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<publish-metadata xmlns="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1 publish-metadata-1.0.xsd">
    <data>
        <asset>
            <id>{{assetId}}</id>
            <titleList>
                <title language="en">Title for {{assetId}} in English</title>
                <title language="sv">Titel för {{assetId}} på Svenska</title>
            </titleList>
            <assetType>movie</assetType>
        </asset>
        <material>
            <materialRef>https://emptestdata.blob.core.windows.net/sources/Sintel/sintel.mp4</materialRef>
            <variants>
                <variant>
                	<id>america</id>
                    <profiles>
                        <profile>america</profile>
                    </profiles>
                    <subtitles>
                        <track>en</track>
                    </subtitles>
                </variant>
                 <variant>
                 	<id>europe</id>
                    <profiles>
                        <profile>europe</profile>
                    </profiles>
                    <subtitles>
                        <track>en</track>
                        <track>es</track>
                    </subtitles>
                </variant>
            </variants>
            <DRMEnabled>false</DRMEnabled>
            <subtitleList>
                <subtitle language="en">https://emptestdata.blob.core.windows.net/sources/shortbbb/bbb_eng_short.vtt</subtitle>

item.description:
All the examples below assume that there is a source file "available on the internet" that can be downloaded by our transcoders.

The file can be made available in multiple ways but some of the most popular ways are

*   A plain HTTP(S) download URL. Either completely open or protected by eg. basic auth or IP filtering.
*   Source file uploaded by you to a AWS S3 bucket or Azure blob storage under OUR control
*   Source file stored on a AWS S3 bucket or Azure blob storage under YOUR control and then credentials with sufficient access rights shared with us
    

For the latter two a small amount of configuration will have to be done by us before the files can be ingested.

See the sub collections *Complete URL* and *Relative URL* below for details.

body.raw:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<publish-metadata xmlns="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1 publish-metadata-1.0.xsd">
	<data>
		<asset>
			<id>{{assetId}}</id>
			<titleList>
				<title language="en">Titler for {{assetId}}</title>
			</titleList>
			<assetType>movie</assetType>
		</asset>
		<material>
			<externalMediaLocatorList>
				<externalMediaLocator drm="UNENCRYPTED" manifestFormat="HLS">https://ps.vemup.ctl.cdn.ebsd.ericsson.net/stream/streambu/assets/APITest0002_2D25B4/materials/zejiu2JKLX_2D25B4/vod-idx-5.ism/.m3u8</externalMediaLocator>
				<externalMediaLocator drm="UNENCRYPTED" manifestFormat="DASH">https://ps.vemup.ctl.cdn.ebsd.ericsson.net/stream/streambu/assets/APITest0002_2D25B4/materials/zejiu2JKLX_2D25B4/vod-idx-5.ism/.mpd</externalMediaLocator>
			</externalMediaLocatorList>
			<DRMEnabled>false</DRMEnabled>
		</material>
	</data>
</publish-metadata>

request.description:
Use this when you want to perform a basic ingest without having any real meta-data available. You have one media file.

It is assumed that the media source file is available directly on internet.

Asset will be published. Note that this means that the asset might be available before it is actually ingested and playable so please consider the publication dates carefully.

body.raw:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<publish-metadata xmlns="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1">
    <data>
        <asset>
            <id>{{assetId}}</id>
            <assetName>Special Asset name</assetName>
            <assetType>movie</assetType>
        </asset>
        <material>
            <provider>RTBF</provider>
            <externalEncoding>
                <source type="STORAGE" removeAfterIngest="false">pre-define</source>
                <videoTracks>
                    <videoTrack>
                        <filename>2143828/2dCIeQjn5O-234p.mp4</filename>
                        <outputFilename>H264_video_234p_200000.mp4</outputFilename>
                        <targetBitrate>200000</targetBitrate>
                        <codec>H264</codec>
                    </videoTrack>
                    <videoTrack>
                        <filename>2143828/2dCIeQjn5O-480p.mp4</filename>
                        <outputFilename>H264_video_480p_1150000.mp4</outputFilename>
                        <targetBitrate>1150000</targetBitrate>
                        <codec>H264</codec>
                    </videoTrack>
                    <videoTrack>
                        <filename>2143828/2dCIeQjn5O-576p.mp4</filename>
                        <outputFilename>H264_video_576p_1600000.mp4</outputFilename>
                        <targetBitrate>1600000</targetBitrate>
                        <codec>H264</codec>
                    </videoTrack>
                    <videoTrack>
                        <filename>2143828/2dCIeQjn5O-720p.mp4</filename>
                        <outputFilename>H264_video_720p_200000.mp4</outputFilename>
                        <targetBitrate>2000000</targetBitrate>
                        <codec>H264</codec>
                    </videoTrack>
                    <videoTrack>
                        <filename>2143828/2dCIeQjn5O-1080p.mp4</filename>
                        <outputFilename>H264_video_1080p_4000000.mp4</outputFilename>
                        <targetBitrate>4000000</targetBitrate>
                        <codec>H264</codec>
                    </videoTrack>
                </videoTracks>
                <audioTracks>
                    <audioTrack>
                        <filename>2143828/2dCIeQjn5O-234p.mp4</filename>
                        <outputFilename>aac_audio_fre_96000.mp4</outputFilename>
                        <targetBitrate>96000</targetBitrate>
                        <displayName>Français</displayName>
                        <language>fr</language>
                        <codec>AAC</codec>
                        <channels>2</channels>
                    </audioTrack>
                    <audioTrack>
                        <filename>2143828/2dCIeQjn5O-480p.mp4</filename>
                        <outputFilename>aac_audio_fre_128000.mp4</outputFilename>
                        <targetBitrate>128000</targetBitrate>
                        <displayName>Français</displayName>
                        <language>fr</language>
                        <codec>AAC</codec>
                        <channels>2</channels>
                    </audioTrack>
                    <audioTrack>
                        <filename>2143828/2dCIeQjn5O-720p.mp4</filename>
                        <outputFilename>aac_audio_fre_192000.mp4</outputFilename>
                        <targetBitrate>192000</targetBitrate>
                        <displayName>Français</displayName>
                        <language>fr</language>
                        <codec>AAC</codec>
                        <channels>2</channels>
                    </audioTrack>
                </audioTracks>
            </externalEncoding>
            <DRMEnabled>false</DRMEnabled>
            <subtitleList>
                <subtitle language="fr" name="Français">2143828/fra.vtt</subtitle>
                <subtitle language="en" name="English">2143828/eng.vtt</subtitle>
            </subtitleList>
            <purgeDate>2030-12-17T00:00:00+01:00</purgeDate>
        </material>
    </data>
</publish-metadata>

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>

         <material>

                </publicationRights>
            </publication>
        </publicationList>
    </data>
</publish-metadata>

                <endTime>2025-01-24T00:00:00.000Z</endTime>

body.raw:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<publish-metadata xmlns="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1 publish-metadata.xsd">
    <data>
        <asset>
            <id>{{assetId}}</id>
            <titleList>
                <title language="en">Vod2Vod</title>
            </titleList>
	       <assetType>movie</assetType>
        </asset>
        <material>
            <vodSource>
                <segments>
                    <segment>
                        <sourceAssetId>{{assetId}}</sourceAssetId>
                    	<sourceMaterialId>{{materialId}}</sourceMaterialId>
                        <start>PT1M10S</start>
                        <end>PT10M43S</end>
                    </segment>
                </segments>
            </vodSource>
            <DRMEnabled>false</DRMEnabled>
        </material>
    </data>
</publish-metadata>

Asset will be published. Note that this means that the asset might be available before it is actually ingested and playable so please consider the publication dates carefully.

item.description:
Video can be ingested into RedBee MOTT in multiple different ways.

In this collection we give an overview of the most common types of ingest methods with a focus on the VIDEO part of the ingest. For detailed examples on how to ingest asset metadata like title, tags and images see the Metdata Ingest collection. For examples regarding how to Publish assets see the Publication collection.

This collection is organised in a few sub collections

# File ingest

One or more source files are available "on the internet" in some way and we will fetch and transcode the source files

# Pretranscoded ingest

Pretranscoded audio and video bitrates are available "on the internet" in some way and we simply copy them to our origin and make them available for streaming.

# External ingest

Manifests (most commonly mpds for DASH or m3u8s for HLS) are already available "on the internet" but you want to make them available in your app. In this case we can just add them as media locators to assets in our system.

# Live2VOD

If you already have live or event channels in the system you can clip out certain segments from the stream and republish as a VOD

VOD2VOD

item.name: Meta-Data Updates

body.raw:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<publish-metadata xmlns="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1 publish-metadata-1.0.xsd">
    <data>
        <asset>
            <id>{{assetId}}</id>
            <!-- The provider must be configured in the system -->
            <provider>provider1</provider>
            <productionYear>2017</productionYear>
            <titleList>
                <title language="en">Title for {{assetId}} in Englisth</title>
                <title language="sv">Title for {{assetId}} in Swedish</title>
            </titleList>
            <descriptionList>
                <description language="en" length="short">A short description in English</description>
                <description language="sv" length="short">A short description in Swedish</description>
                <description language="en" length="medium">A medium description in English</description>
                <description language="sv" length="medium">A medium description in Swedish</description>
                <description language="en" length="long">A long description in English</description>
                <description language="sv" length="long">A long description in Swedish</description>
            </descriptionList>
            <!-- The tags must exist -->
            <tagList>
                <tagIdRef>genre_drama</tagIdRef>
                <tagIdRef>genre_thriller</tagIdRef>
            </tagList>
            <imageList>
            	 <image language="sv">
                    <id>image1</id>
                    <url>http://myhost.se/myPath/MyImageInSv.jpg</url>
                    <width>1280</width>
                    <height>720</height>
                    <purpose>banner</purpose>
                    <orientation>landscape</orientation>
                </image>
                <image language="en">
                    <id>image2</id>
                    <url>http://myhost.se/myPath/MyImageInEn.jpg</url>
                    <width>1280</width>
                    <height>720</height>
                    <purpose>banner</purpose>
                    <orientation>landscape</orientation>
                </image>
            </imageList>
            <!-- The parantal ratings must be pre-configured in the system -->
            <parentalRatingList>
                <parentalRating>
                    <rating>15</rating>
                    <scheme>age</scheme>
                    <country>GB</country>
                </parentalRating>
                <parentalRating>
                    <rating>15</rating>
                    <scheme>age</scheme>
                    <country>SE</country>
                </parentalRating>
            </parentalRatingList>
            <assetType>movie</assetType>
        </asset>
    </data>
</publish-metadata>

request.description: Use this when you want to create or update meta-data for an asset.

body.raw:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<publish-metadata xmlns="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1">
    <data>
        <season>
            <id>{{seasonId}}</id>
            <titleList>
                <title language="en">Season title for {{seasonId}} in English</title>
                <title language="sv">Season titel för {{seasonId}} på Svenska</title>
            </titleList>
            <descriptionList>
                <description language="en" length="short">A short season description in English</description>
                <description language="sv" length="short">A short season description in Swedish</description>
                <description language="en" length="medium">A medium season description in English</description>
                <description language="sv" length="medium">A medium season description in Swedish</description>
                <description language="en" length="long">A long season description in English</description>
                <description language="sv" length="long">A long season description in Swedish</description>
            </descriptionList>
            <tagList/>
            <imageList>
                <image language="sv">
                    <id>image1</id>
                    <url>http://myhost.se/myPath/MyImageInSv.jpg</url>
                    <purpose>banner</purpose>
                    <orientation>landscape</orientation>
                </image>
                <image language="en">
                    <id>image2</id>
                    <url>http://myhost.se/myPath/MyImageInEn.jpg</url>
                    <purpose>banner</purpose>
                    <orientation>landscape</orientation>
                </image>
            </imageList>
            <seriesId>{{seasonId}}</seriesId>
            <seasonNumber>1</seasonNumber>
            <numberOfEpisodes>26</numberOfEpisodes>
        </season>
    </data>
</publish-metadata>

request.description: Use this when you want to create or update meta-data for an asset.

body.raw:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<publish-metadata xmlns="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1 publish-metadata-1.0.xsd">
	<data>
		<asset>
    		<id>{{assetId}}</id>
    		<titleList>
    			<title language="en">Title for {{assetId}} in English</title>
    		</titleList>
    		<assetType>episode</assetType>
    		<seriesId>{{seriesId}}</seriesId>
    		<seasonId>{{seasonId}}</seasonId>
    		<episodeNumber>{{episodeNumber}}</episodeNumber>
        </asset>
	</data>
</publish-metadata>

request.description:
Use this when you want to perform a basic ingest without having any real meta-data available. You have one media file.

It is assumed that the there is a storage location defined inside RedBee platform. This is why providing only relative paths are good enough. A storage can be defined either for a whole organization unit or for an organization when a specific provider is defined for the material.

Asset will not be published.

body.raw:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<publish-metadata xmlns="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1">
    <data>
        <series>
            <id>{{seriesId}}</id>
            <titleList>
                <title language="en">Series title for {{seriesId}} in English</title>
                <title language="sv">Series titel för {{seriesId}} på Svenska</title>
            </titleList>
            <descriptionList>
                <description language="en" length="short">A short series description in English</description>
                <description language="sv" length="short">A short series description in Swedish</description>
                <description language="en" length="medium">A medium series description in English</description>
                <description language="sv" length="medium">A medium series description in Swedish</description>
                <description language="en" length="long">A long series description in English</description>
                <description language="sv" length="long">A long series description in Swedish</description>
            </descriptionList>
            <tagList/>
            <imageList>
                <image language="sv">
                    <id>image1</id>
                    <url>http://myhost.se/myPath/MyImageInSv.jpg</url>
                    <purpose>banner</purpose>
                    <orientation>landscape</orientation>
                </image>
                <image language="en">
                    <id>image2</id>
                    <url>http://myhost.se/myPath/MyImageInEn.jpg</url>
                    <purpose>banner</purpose>
                    <orientation>landscape</orientation>
                </image>
            </imageList>
        </series>
    </data>
</publish-metadata>

request.description: Use this when you want to create or update meta-data for an asset.

body.raw:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<publish-metadata xmlns="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1 publish-metadata-1.0.xsd">
	<data>
		<asset>
    		<id>{{assetId}}</id>
    		<titleList>
    			<title language="en">Title for {{assetId}} in English</title>
    		</titleList>
    		<assetType>episode</assetType>
    		<seriesId>{{seriesId}}</seriesId>
    		<seasonId>{{seasonId}}</seasonId>
    		<episodeNumber>{{episodeNumber}}</episodeNumber>
        </asset>
        <material>
			<materialRef>https://emptestdata.blob.core.windows.net/sources/Sintel/sintel.mp4</materialRef>
			<DRMEnabled>true</DRMEnabled>
		</material>
	</data>
</publish-metadata>

request.description:
Use this when you want to perform a basic ingest without having any real meta-data available. You have one media file.

It is assumed that the there is a storage location defined inside RedBee platform. This is why providing only relative paths are good enough. A storage can be defined either for a whole organization unit or for an organization when a specific provider is defined for the material.

Asset will not be published.

body.raw:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<publish-metadata xmlns="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1 publish-metadata-1.0.xsd">
    <data>
        <asset>
            <id>{{assetId}}</id>
            <!-- The provider must be configured in the system -->
            <provider>provider1</provider>
            <productionYear>2017</productionYear>
            <titleList>
                <title language="en">Title for {{assetId}} in Englisth</title>
                <title language="sv">Title for {{assetId}} in Swedish</title>
            </titleList>
            <descriptionList>
                <description language="en" length="short">A short description in English</description>
                <description language="sv" length="short">A short description in Swedish</description>
                <description language="en" length="medium">A medium description in English</description>
                <description language="sv" length="medium">A medium description in Swedish</description>
                <description language="en" length="long">A long description in English</description>
                <description language="sv" length="long">A long description in Swedish</description>
            </descriptionList>
            <!-- The tags must exist -->
            <tagList>
                <tagIdRef>genre_drama</tagIdRef>
                <tagIdRef>genre_thriller</tagIdRef>
            </tagList>
            <imageList>
            	 <image language="sv">
                    <id>image1</id>
                    <url>http://myhost.se/myPath/MyImageInSv.jpg</url>
                    <width>1280</width>
                    <height>720</height>
                    <purpose>banner</purpose>
                    <orientation>landscape</orientation>
                </image>
                <image language="en">
                    <id>image2</id>
                    <url>http://myhost.se/myPath/MyImageInEn.jpg</url>
                    <width>1280</width>
                    <height>720</height>
                    <purpose>banner</purpose>
                    <orientation>landscape</orientation>
                </image>
            </imageList>
            <!-- The parantal ratings must be pre-configured in the system -->
            <parentalRatingList>
                <parentalRating>
                    <rating>15</rating>
                    <scheme>age</scheme>
                    <country>GB</country>
                </parentalRating>
                <parentalRating>
                    <rating>15</rating>
                    <scheme>age</scheme>
                    <country>SE</country>
                </parentalRating>
            </parentalRatingList>
            <assetType>movie</assetType>
        </asset>
        <material>
            <materialRef>https://emptestdata.blob.core.windows.net/sources/Sintel/sintel.mp4</materialRef>
            <DRMEnabled>true</DRMEnabled>
        </material>
    </data>
</publish-metadata>

request.description:
Use this when you want to perform an ingest when localised data is available. You have one media file.

It is assumed that the media source file is available directly on internet.

Asset will not be published.

item.description: If you don't have the media files available yet you can still create the asset and start to work on the meta-data. You can also update the update later, before or after the media files are actually ingested. The message to send in is the same as for a ingest resulting in a transcoding, the difference is that you do not provide a material.

item.name: Publications

body.raw:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<publish-metadata xmlns="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://video-metadata.emp.ebsd.ericsson.net/publish-metadata/v1 publish-metadata-1.0.xsd">
    <data>
        <publicationList>
            <publication>
                <id>{{assetId}}</id>
                <assetIdRef>{{assetId}}</assetIdRef>
                <startTime>2020-01-24T00:00:00.000Z</startTime>
                <endTime>2025-01-24T00:00:00.000Z</endTime>
                <publishTime>2019-12-01T00:00:00.000Z</publishTime>
                <publicationRights>
                    <productList>
                        <product>{{productId}}</product>
                    </productList>
                </publicationRights>
            </publication>
        </publicationList>
    </data>
</publish-metadata>

request.description: Use this when you want to add or update a publication for an asset.
Use this when you want to add or update a publication for an asset.

item.description: You can at any point add or change your publications. If a publication with your provided ID already exist for an asset it will be replaced, otherwise it will be added.
